thread.section_title: Retail News - Wall Street Journal - Wsj.com
thread.title: Canada Retail Sales Rise 0.3% In January

author: Kim Mackrael
title: Canada Retail Sales Rise 0.3% In January
text:
OTTAWAâ€”Canadian retail sales rose at a slower-than-expected pace in January as a decline in the motor vehicle and parts industry weighed on overall sales.
The value of retail sales in January increased 0.3% on a seasonally adjusted basis to 49.87 billion Canadian dollars ($38.64 billion), Statistics Canada said Friday, following a revised 0.7% decline in the previous month. Market expectations were for retail sales to rise 1.1% in January, according to economists at Royal Bank of Canada.
